title: BBC模仿秀: 贝尔天价加盟皇马

description:
《英文天天写》是沪江部落一档写作类节目，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

背景介绍：

The Plight of Higher Education

China is witnessing a historical large number of graduates (6.99 m) this year. And numerous our young graduates are suffering from unemployment whereas enterprises also complaining about the difficulties of finding qualified candidates for vacant positions.

On the other side of our planet, due to the economic crises, youth unemployment is a most pressing problem facing Europe as well. Thanks to a dual system of schooling (academic education and vocational education) and working experience, Germany, however, became a winner in reducing youth unemployment rate again.

话题：

Germany’s experience reminds us about this week’s topic:
1. Do we really need an academic-orientated course in our universities and colleges, regardless of what job markets’ needs? Or do our higher education system should concentrate more on practical knowledge that urgently needed by the job market?
2. What kind of qualities that our enterprises are looking for?
3. Write about anything that related with finding a job.

范例1：

People hold different perceptions of tertiary education. Although higher education is recognised by many as the most important predictor of one’s success, its efficacy has been subject to long discussion. Higher education, in my opinion, should be a hybrid of academic education and vocational education.

To begin with, nobody can deny that academic education in our universities and colleges are successful to some extent. Numerous famous scientists and professors in the top universities worldwide, more or less, have education backgrounds from Chinese universities or colleges. Furthermore, academic knowledge can lay a solid foundation for individual’s career development. And it is also beneficial for improving critical thinking skills, analytical skills as well as problem-solving skills, which are crucial to augment the average population quality of China.

However, admittedly, the majority of graduates will find a job in the end. Therefore, naturally, they expect to gain a promising and decent future through higher education. That is the reason why tertiary education should concentrate more on vocational education instead of pure academic training. Moreover, not all the knowledge, experience and skills can be imparted to students by teaching. Apprenticeships, as far as I am concerned, should be an alternative option.

So, from the junior year on, our universities and colleges can offer various courses that range from academic educations to vocational educations, which can be chosen on the principle of individual’s future plan. And in the last year, more intern opportunities as well as apprentice positions should be available for those students who want to find a job after graduation.

To summarise, the tertiary education are the future of our country and it should be more flexible and customisable to our students in accord with the reality needs of our society.

范例2：

As the huge amount of graduates surge into the labour force each year, the competition in job market is unbelievable fierce which results in a high unemployment rate. Looking into the root of the circumstances, some blame that the academic sector has been over-emphasised in college while the technical training is relatively insufficient. Personally, I would side with this opinion.

Firstly, we should clarify the main purpose of college education. In China, it is widely believed that a college degree is the ticket to a decent life. For this reason, the majority of candidates struggle to knock into the gates of universities. Meanwhile employers tend to offer higher wage to the graduates, who are considered to be much capable to fulfill the posts. By those common values, universities indeed have the obligation to satisfy the vocational demand both from students and employers.

Moreover, one of the important missions of education is to equip students with the employment skills. The working period takes a major proportion in our life. Besides, the academic knowledge without any practical use is a mere abstraction, which is totally worthless. Therefore, colleges should evaluate the curriculum and integrate some technical elements into the theoretical field. It not only can promote the practical use of their courses but enhance students’ enthusiasm for learning as well.

All in all, university education is essential to our society. The authorities should spare no effects to devise a well-rounded curriculum so as to catch up with the diverse learning needs.

description:
《英闻天天译》是一档沪江部落的原创翻译互动节目（戳去参与节目>>>），主持人提供翻译参考文本，对大家递交的翻译作品进行点评，和大家共同进步！本期节目选取的是关于最伟大的演讲的一则英文报道，让我们一起在翻译中关注。

SUMMARY:

半个世纪前，马丁·路德·金（Martin Luther King）侃侃而谈自己的梦想，约翰·肯尼迪（JFK）则称自己为一个柏林人。这两次演讲都名留青史，但历史上到底哪次演讲最棒呢？我们邀请了六位撰稿人做出自己的选择。山姆·雷斯（Sam Leith）为这次讨论设下基调。

CONTENT：
Fifty years ago Martin Luther King stood on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial and declared: "I have a dream." His words were heard, it is for once no exaggeration to say, around the world. Whole passages now live in folk memory; and, with its formal links to the black folk pulpit and the language of the Book of Amos, the speech itself drew on folk memory.
Great speeches don't come out of nowhere. Threads of debt and inheritance tie the earliest recorded oratory to the speeches of the present day. Every speech relies for its power on the common language of the tribe, and that language is itself shaped by the great speeches of the past.

KEYWORDS：

1. exaggeration  张，夸大之词       

2. pulpit         n. 讲道坛；高架操纵台；神职人员

3. inheritance   继承，遗传，遗产

4. oratory  雄辩，演讲术

5. tribe  部落

【沪江英语小编】大家在查看主持人提供的翻译版本前，可以先自己进行尝试翻译练习，只有在不断的翻译中翻译能力才能有所提升哦！
轻松注册沪江，马上参与【英闻天天译】节目练翻译→

本期节目参考译文：（参考译文由该节目主持人提供，仅供参考，欢迎大家讨论）

参考译文1：

50年前，马丁·路德·金站在林肯纪念堂外的台阶上宣布：“我有一个梦想。”我们毫不夸张的说，那一次全世界人都听到了他的呐喊。整篇演讲中许多段落至今仍在民间流传。这篇演讲与黑人民间传说有千丝万缕的联系，加上它引用了许多《阿摩司书》中的言辞，这篇演讲深深地印在了人们的记忆中。
伟大的演讲不是凭空想象的。千丝万缕的借鉴与传承将亘古的雄辩和今日的演讲联系起来。所有演讲其力量都来自于部落的共同语言，而部落的语言又从过去伟大的演讲中衍生出来。

参考译文2：

五十年前马丁·路德·金站在林肯纪念堂的阶梯上向世人宣称：“我有一个梦想”。他的演说，毫不夸张地说，传遍了整个世界。他的这篇演讲如今仍深深印在人们的脑海中，它还和黑人民间布道以及《阿摩柯书》中的语言有极为正式的联系，这演讲本身取材自民间。
伟大的演讲不可能凭空冒出。借鉴和传承将古之雄辩和今之讲演联系起来。所有演讲所依持的力量来自部落的共同语言，而这些语言同时也被这些伟大的演讲所改造。

title: 英闻天天译: 最伟大的演讲

description:
《美剧天坛秀》节目是沪江部落一档模仿类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语水平，在轻松看美剧的同时锻炼大家的口语能力。积极参与的童鞋还会得到主持的专业点评哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

原录音：

原文：S: And you don't even talk to her. why do you care how she does?
B: Nelly Yuki has her sights set on Yale, too. What are the odds of them accepting two girls from constance? And have you seen Nelly Yuki's extracurriculars? I need to kick her well-rounded ass.
S: And they say you've lost your edge.
B: Nelly Yuki must be destroyed.
S: Why do you keep saying her name？
B: Because it's Nelly Yuki.
Ew,gross. Incoming--Chuck. You ready?
S: No, I gotta wait for Dan. He's pretty stressed.
He doesn't do well in tests, so...
B:Performance anxiety?
S: Bye,Blair.

重点单词发音讲解：

constance
英['kɔnstəns] 美['kɔnstəns]
n. 女子名
 
extracurriculars
英[ekstrəkə'rikjulə] 美[ekstrəkə'rikjulə]
adj. 课外的；课程以外的
 
kick
英[kɪk] 美[kɪk]
v. 踢，蹬；戒除（恶习）；反冲；反对，反抗
n. 踢，蹬；反冲，后座力；极度兴奋
 
edge
英[ɛdʒ] 美[ɛdʒ]
n. 边，边缘；刀，刀口
v. 使徐徐移动；给...加边
 
gross
英[ɡrəʊs] 美[groʊs]
adj. 总的；恶劣的；肉眼可见的，下流的，臃肿的；茂密的，粗略的，繁盛的，粗略的，迟钝的，肉体的，粗劣的；粗野的，明显的，实得的
n. 总额，总量；罗；大多数
v. 获得...总收入，赚得总收入
 
anxiety
英[æŋ'zaiəti] 美[æŋ'zaiəti]
n. 焦虑，挂念；令人焦虑之事；渴望
